In nature and daily life, the solid–liquid interface (SLI) between ionic crystals and solutions is ubiquitous. Many important physical phenomena and processes occur around SLIs, which are the key to understand the properties of two-phase boundary,
1− 4 flotation,
5− 8 crystal dissolution,
9− 12 growth,
9, 12− 15 etc. For a long time, scientists have made great efforts to investigate the intrinsic feature of SLIs by various experimental techniques and computer simulations.
